description: Students explore the history and culture of Ghana and examine how people recall slavery
and the implications of a constructed concept of slavery. Through primary sources and
visits to historic sites, students examine how Africans view slavery; why descendants of
slavers and the enslaved rarely discuss slavery; how to transform slave artifacts into
storehouses of memory, silences, and fragmentations in history; and how descendants of
slaves respond to the burden of such knowledge. Offered during Interim. Apply through
International and Off-Campus Studies. Also counts toward Africa and the African Diaspora and race
